message: @yrashk you should add the possibility for users to submit stats usage
about 40 peoples visit the web site every day
Interesting. I had not heard of agner before.  I wonder if I can use it to solve Mochi's local mirror problem.
not sure how
not the best one, but gives some idea, yes
avg.
Some people do
github repo has 45 watchers and 5 forks https://github.com/agner/agner , that's the only measurable clue I guess on usage for now
what's the problem?
Really I want something like local maven repos/apt repositories.

We mirror a whole bunch of repos from github into our local data center.  We use rebar to depend on all of these and right now our solution to make sure they come from our local data center is to have a top-level dependency that redefines every dep to point to the local mirror.
@dreid basically, that Clojars inspiration part sounds like the direction that might solve your issues, Clojars are pretty much based on Maven, as far as I know

Yeah, agner can be used in a scenario like that... It will require very minor addition to it (such as an additional index access module like agner_github, basically it will be almost the same except for repositories/0)
feel free to message me if you guys will need help in setting this up
I haven't been around proper Java for many years, so I am not sure about that, just used Clojure a bit recently
@yrashk Yeah it looks like what we'd want might be something like an agner_cgit which knows how to find .agner repos given a cgit URL.
@dreid, yeah, totally possible with an addition of an index module. let me know if you'll have any questions.
loving me some agner
@yrashk Now if only CGIT had a JSON API…
@dreid htmlf("<tr><td class='%s'>", !sorted && section ? "sublevel-repo" : "toplevel-repo");
@dreid the alternative would be to use the same thing that our crawler does
@dreid no need for json api, you can copycat agner_github to crawl cgit
@dreid agner supports different types of index access modules
If someone hasn't done it already, I might just write an LWRP for Chef to use Agner. That would be the shit.
@lusis that would be sweet!
